title: Overcoming Fear to Evangelize
sub_title: Sharing the Light Through Your Story
devotional:
Eliza had always felt a pull, a gentle tug, towards sharing the joy she found in her faith. But fear held her back. What if she wasn't eloquent enough? What if people rejected her? What if she stumbled over her words and misrepresented the Gospel? These 'what ifs' formed a thick wall around her heart, silencing the whispers of the Holy Spirit urging her to speak.

One sweltering August afternoon, while volunteering at a local soup kitchen, Eliza encountered a young man named David. He was quiet, withdrawn, and carried a weariness that seemed to settle around him like the summer humidity. As they worked side-by-side, ladling soup and handing out bread, Eliza felt a nudge to simply ask him how he was doing, truly listen, and see where God led. Swallowing her anxieties, she turned to David and, with genuine warmth, asked, "How are you holding up today, David?"

David's face softened slightly. He shared his struggles – unemployment, a sick mother, a deep sense of hopelessness. Eliza listened, her heart aching for him. She didn't offer easy platitudes or canned Christian phrases. Instead, she shared a brief story of a time she faced a similar situation and how her faith in God had sustained her, giving her strength and peace to endure. She offered a simple truth: that God sees him, loves him, and wants to help him carry his burdens. She didn't preach; she simply shared her experience.

As David listened, a flicker of hope ignited in his eyes. He confessed that he had drifted away from his faith in his youth, but Eliza's authenticity stirred something within him. They talked a while longer, and before he left, David thanked her, saying, "I needed to hear that today. Thank you for… just listening."

Eliza realized then that evangelism isn't about delivering polished sermons or having all the answers. It's about being present, listening with compassion, and sharing your own story of faith in a genuine, heartfelt way. It's about letting God's light shine through you, however dimly you may perceive it, to touch another person's life. It is about planting seeds, trusting God to provide the harvest in His timing.
image_description: A winding dirt path leading through a field of golden wheat under a partly cloudy sky, suggesting harvest and growth.
insights: Eliza's experience aligns with the biblical understanding of evangelism as sharing one's personal testimony. Revelation 12:11 says, 'And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony.' This emphasizes the power of personal stories in conveying the reality of faith. Also, 1 Peter 3:15 reminds us to 'always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect,' highlighting the importance of humility and compassion in evangelistic encounters.
prayer: Heavenly Father, forgive me for the times I have allowed fear to silence me from sharing Your love with others. Grant me the courage to step outside my comfort zone and be a light in the darkness. Help me to listen with compassion, speak with authenticity, and trust that You will use my humble efforts to touch the hearts of those around me. Fill me with Your Holy Spirit, that I may be a vessel of Your grace and a witness to Your saving power. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What are your own fears or anxieties about sharing your faith? Can you identify a time when a simple act of kindness or listening made a difference in someone's life? How can you be more intentional about creating opportunities to share your story of faith with others in a genuine and authentic way?
